p: The oscillation of melatonin concentration in the leaves of H. perforatum L. entrained to an 18-h light: 6-h dark [Zeitgeber time (ZT)] and transferred to constant light [circadian time (CT)] conditions was measured. We observed that a melatonin rhythm with rather modest amplitude was controlled by the circadian clock, peaking at approximately CT6 in the middle of the subjective day (Fig.Â 3).
